name: elevator production, hydraulic | elevator, hydraulic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21328/documentation

This activity represents the production and disposal of an average hydraulic elevator used in buildings.The elevator is 2490 kg in mass where 1864 kg accounts for the elevator car and the remaining weight is attributed to the material required to manufacture the elevator shaft and movable parts. The elevator has the nominal load of 1000 kg. It has the envisaged lifetime of 80 years (where the actual service life of the elevator car is 20 years) and is manufactured in Europe. The figures on material inputs from technosphere and energy required to produce an average hydraulic elevator are taken from Miljogiraff 2015. The figure on the annual production volume (803000 units) is assumed to be equal to the annual world sales and is from PRNewswire 2016.

This activity starts with the reception of materials at the factory.

The activity includes the processes of material and energy use in manufacturing of an average hydraulic elevator. Energy required to install an elevator in a building is excluded The inventory additionally accounts for disposal of all materials. Packaging is not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/28:Manufacture of machinery and equipment n.e.c./281:Manufacture of general-purpose machinery/2816:Manufacture of lifting and handling equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The literature sources used refer to the underpinning technology as being current.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Geography GLO was chosen because the dataset aims to represent the production of an average hydraulic elevator. The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The literature sources used refer to manufacturing in Europe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data on annual world production is assumed to equate to the amount of annual world sales.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data are taken from Miljogiraff 2015. Data on the annual production volume are assumed to be equal to the annual volume of unit sales and taken from PRNewswire 2016. Sources: Miljogiraff 2015. LCA of elevator lifting service in property. Report ordered by Hydroware, Number 70. Available from: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Marcus_Wendin/publication/301295772_Elevators_towards_a_circular_economy/links/5717790f08ae2679a8c772db/Elevators-towards-a-circular-economy.pdf (Accessed 11 January 2018). PRNewswire 2016. Global and China Elevator Industry Report, 2016-2020. Available from: https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/global-and-china-elevator-industry-report-2016-2020-300310552.html (Accessed 11 January 2018).

exchanges.description: Estimated value.The input of infrastructure is approximated with the exchange 'metal working factory', this was chosen as metal is the main material constituting the final product. The general comment for the activity 'metal working faculty, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018] specifies: '4.58E-10 units of this process are needed to produce 1 kg of final product. Additionally, the dataset for 'metal working factory' needs to be used together with the 'energy and auxilliary inputs, metal working factory', 1 kg of this exchange is required per 1 kg of final product.

The general comment for the activity 'metal working faculty, GLO' [accessed 19.01.2018] specifies: '4.58E-10 units of this process are needed to produce 1 kg of final product. Additionally, the dataset for 'metal working factory' needs to be used together with the 'energy and auxilliary inputs, metal working factory', 1 kg of this exchange is required per 1 kg of final product.
